DataElement.preferredName: Total Plan Dose Administered 0 Decimal Place Milligram per Kilogram Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric milligram per kilogram value of the total planned dose administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._To devise, contrive, or form in design._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
To devise, contrive, or form in design.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Total Medication Dose 0 Decimal Place Milligram per Kilogram Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Total Medication Dose Integer::0 Decimal Place Milligram per Kilogram Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
